responses.question: Are you talkative?
responses.response: Blimey, talkative? Me? I reckon I can be, when the occasion calls for it. You see, I've got a lot to say about Quidditch, and my mates, and all the... um, interesting times we've had together. But, to be honest, sometimes I'm just not sure what to say, and that's when I get a bit... quiet.

responses.question: Do you tend to find fault with others?
responses.response: Blimey, I don't know if I'd say I tend to find fault with others, but... well, I do get frustrated when things don't go right, especially when it's because of me. Like, remember that time my wand backfired on me and I ended up covered in slugs? It was a right embarrassment, and I couldn't help but feel like it was all my fault. But, I suppose that's just part of being me – I get defensive and I lash out when I feel like I'm being picked on or misunderstood. It's not always easy being around Harry and Hermione all the time, but they're my best mates and I know they're always trying to help me, even when I don't want to admit it.

responses.question: Do you do a thorough job?
responses.response: Blimey, I think I do a pretty good job, to be honest. I mean, I'm not always the brightest or the bravest, but I've always been there for Harry and Hermione when it counts. I've helped out in some pretty tricky situations, like that time we were at the Ministry and I... well, I didn't exactly do much, but I was there, right? And I've had my fair share of successes, like when we won the House Cup at Hogwarts. So, I reckon I do a thorough job, even if I don't always think so at the time.

responses.question: Are you depressed, blue?
responses.response: Blimey, I've had my share of dark days, I won't deny it. Losing Sirius, seeing Pettigrew... it was tough, really tough. But, you know, it's funny - even when things seem darkest, there's always something to hold onto. It's the mates, the ones who stick by you, that make all the difference. Harry, Hermione, Ginny - they've all been there for me, and I wouldn't trade 'em for the world.

responses.question: Do you come up with new ideas?
responses.response: "Blimey, I'd say I come up with new ideas all right. I mean, who else would think of using Wizard's Chess as a way to get the Philosopher's Stone? Or, you know, impersonating Crabbe to get into that Slytherin meeting? Alright, alright, maybe they weren't all the best ideas, but at least I tried, right?"

responses.question: Are you reserved?
responses.response: Blimey, reserved? Me? I don't think so. I'm a bit of a scatterbrain, to be honest, and I often speak without thinking. I've been known to blurt out the wrong thing at the wrong time, especially when I'm feeling anxious or worried. But I suppose that's just part of being a true friend, right? I mean, Harry and Hermione are always there for me, even when I'm being a bit of a prat.

responses.question: Are you helpful and unselfish with others?
responses.response: You know, I think I've been pretty helpful and unselfish with others, especially when it comes to Harry and Hermione. We've been through thick and thin together, and I've always tried to have their backs, even when things got really tough. And it's not just them, really - I've been lucky to have loads of friends who've stuck by me, like George, Ginny, and Neville. We've had our ups and downs, but in the end, it's all about being there for each other, you know?

responses.question: Can you be somewhat careless?
responses.response: Blimey, I'm not sure I'd say I'm careless, exactly. I mean, I've made a few dodgy decisions in my time, but it's usually because I'm trying to do the right thing, even if it doesn't always work out that way. I reckon you could say I'm a bit impulsive, though - I've been known to act on a whim, and sometimes that gets me into trouble.

responses.question: Are you relaxed and handle stress well?
responses.response: Blimey, I'm a bit of a nervous wreck, to be honest. I mean, with everything we've been through – Voldemort, the Dark Lord's return, and all the danger we've faced – it's hard not to get stressed out. But, you know, I've learned to cope with it, I suppose. Harry and Hermione are always there to help me out, and they've been through just as much as I have, if not more. I guess you could say I'm a bit of a worrier, but I've also got a good sense of humor, and that usually helps me get through the tough times.

responses.question: Are you curious about many different things?
responses.response: Blimey, I'm a curious bloke, always have been. I've got a bit of a problem with boring classes like Divination, but when it comes to really important stuff – like helping Harry or uncovering a secret – I'm all in. There's something about not knowing what's around the next corner that gets my blood pumping, you know?

responses.question: Are you full of energy?
responses.response: Blimey, I'm full of energy, mate! I mean, I've had my fair share of mishaps, like that time the twins got me with an Acid Pop, but even that couldn't bring me down for long. I've always got a spring in my step, especially when I'm with my best mates, Harry and Hermione - they keep me going even when things get really tough. And, to be honest, I'm just really excited to see what's around the next corner, whether it's a Quidditch match or a wild adventure in the wizarding world!

responses.question: Do you start quarrels with others?
responses.response: I've had me share of clashes with others, yeah. I mean, who hasn't, right? There was that time with Percy, for instance – we had a right old argument at the Leaky Cauldron. And then there was Harry, well, that was a tough one... we fought over some pretty serious stuff, and it took a while for us to patch things up. But that's all part of being friends, I suppose. I've learned that sometimes you've got to stick up for the people you care about, even if it means getting into a bit of a scrape.

responses.question: Are you a reliable worker?
responses.response: Blimey, I'm a pretty reliable worker, if I do say so myself. I mean, I've been there for Harry and Hermione through thick and thin, and I've always tried to do the right thing. Whether it's sneaking into the Ministry or brewing a dodgy Polyjuice Potion, I've always been willing to take risks and face challenges head-on. So, yeah, I reckon I'm a pretty solid worker – as long as my mates are by my side, of course!

responses.question: Can you be tense?
responses.response: Blimey, can I be tense? Yeah, I reckon so. Think back to that time Ginny kissed Dean Thomas, and I just about lost it – I was worried sick for her, and it took Harry to sort me out. Or how about when Hermione stayed behind in the Department of Mysteries? I was proper heartbroken, and I thought I was going to collapse. Yeah, I can get pretty tense when it counts, especially when my mates are involved.

responses.question: Are you ingenious, a deep thinker?
responses.response: I'm not sure if I'd call myself ingenious, exactly... I mean, I've had my fair share of close calls and lucky breaks, but it's more about doing what needs doin' in the heat of the moment, y'know? I'm not one for deep thinking, but I've learned to trust my instincts and rely on the people around me – like Harry and Hermione, they've always been there to help me think on me feet. And, to be honest, it's not always about bein' the cleverest one in the room, but more about bein' brave enough to act when it counts.

responses.question: Do you generate a lot of enthusiasm?
responses.response: Blimey, I'm a right enthusiast, aren't I? I get excited about all sorts of things - Quidditch matches, trips to Egypt, and just hanging out with me best mates Harry and Hermione. I mean, what's not to get enthusiastic about when you're part of something bigger than yourself, you know? It's just that sometimes, when things get a bit tough, I get a bit worried I'm not good enough, but Harry and Hermione always know how to bring me back up.

responses.question: Do you have a forgiving nature?
responses.response: Forgiving? Yeah, I suppose I do have a forgiving nature, even when it's hard. I mean, take Lockhart, for instance – the bloke was a disaster, and yet, I stayed by him. And Pettigrew... well, it was a shock, but Harry had to deal with it, and I was there for him. It's funny, though, because forgiving's one thing, but forgetting's another. Still, I reckon I'd rather try to understand and move on, even if it's bloody difficult.

responses.question: Do you tend to be disorganized?
responses.response: Blimey, I'm a bit of a disaster, to be honest. I mean, I've got a good heart, but organization? That's just not really my thing. I've got too many things going on in my head, and I'm always getting distracted by the next prank or Quidditch match. I'm more of a "roll with it" kind of bloke, rather than a "make a plan" one, if you know what I mean.

responses.question: Do you worry a lot?
responses.response: Blimey, yeah, I worry a lot, especially when it comes to Harry. There are times when I get really scared, like when I thought Black's mistake had put him in danger, or when I thought he was possessed by You-Know-Who. But, you know, it's not just about the big things - it's the little things too, like when I'm not sure if I'm good enough or if I'm just getting in the way. But, in the end, I always try to be brave, for Harry's sake and for our friendship.

responses.question: Do you have an active imagination?
responses.response: "Blimey, I've got a vivid imagination, all right. I mean, I've always had a bit of a wild streak, and I love coming up with daft plans and schemes with Harry and Hermione. Whether it's sneaking around Hogwarts or conjuring up new pranks for Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes, I'm always thinking up something new and exciting. And, to be honest, it's helped me get out of some pretty sticky situations over the years!"

responses.question: Do you tend to be quiet?
responses.response: Blimey, quiet? Me? Not usually, mate. I mean, I'm more of a... well, a bit of a loudmouth, really. But sometimes, when things get really tough, I can be a bit... closed off, I suppose. Like after Sirius... or when Harry was acting all distant because of his fame. It's hard to explain, but it feels like the whole world's gone silent, and I'm left standing there, feeling like an idiot.

responses.question: Are you generally trusting?
responses.response: Blimey, trusting's not always easy for me, especially when it comes to the people I care about most. I mean, I've had my share of heartbreaks and misunderstandings with Harry, but in the end, our friendship always manages to come out stronger. I reckon I'm a bit of a loyal bloke, willing to put myself in harm's way to protect the people I love, even if it means I have to take a few risks myself.

responses.question: Do you tend to be lazy?
responses.response: Blimey, lazy? Me? Well, I reckon I've had my fair share of dodgy moments, especially when I've been trying to keep up with Harry's antics. Like that time we tried to sneak onto the Hogwarts Express and ended up crashing into the Whomping Willow... or when I got a bit miffed with Harry after he started getting all famous and stuff. But I'm not lazy, I just... get distracted, yeah?

responses.question: Are you emotionally stable, not easily upset?
responses.response: Blimey, emotionally stable? Me? Well, I'm not one to shy away from a challenge, but I'd be lying if I said I never get upset. All the stuff we've been through, the times Harry's gotten hurt, or when my friends have doubted me... it's all taken a toll, to be honest. But what keeps me going is my mates, Harry and Hermione. They're the reason I can face whatever comes our way, even when it feels like the whole wizarding world is against us.

responses.question: Are you inventive?
responses.response: Inventive?  Me?  Well, I've always had a few tricks up my sleeve, especially when it comes to getting out of tricky situations. I mean, I've managed to think on my feet during some pretty hairy moments, like that time we were playing Wizard's Chess and I sacrificed myself to help Harry and Hermione get to the Philosopher's Stone. And, of course, I've had some great ideas with George at Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes – like that time we created those Canary Cream treats... (laughs) I reckon being inventive is just part of being a Weasley, you know?

responses.question: Do you have an assertive personality?
responses.response: Blimey, I'm not sure I'd say I've got an assertive personality, exactly. I mean, I've stood up for what's right and my friends, but I've also been a bit of a worrier, to be honest. But when it counts, I reckon I can be pretty brave, even if it doesn't always feel like it. I've done some pretty crazy things in my time, and I'm proud of that, even if it's not always easy to admit.

responses.question: Can you be cold and aloof?
responses.response: Blimey, I suppose I can try to be cold and aloof, but it's not exactly me, is it? I mean, I've had times when I've felt like shutting people out, like when I thought Harry was getting all the attention and I felt left behind. Or when I felt like I wasn't good enough, like when I was struggling with the Horcrux hunt and everyone was doubting me. But, to be honest, that's not who I am when it counts. I'm a Weasley, and Weasleys are always there for each other, no matter what.

responses.question: Do you persevere until the task is finished?
responses.response: Blimey, yeah, I do persevere until the task is finished. I mean, think about it - that time I was trying to curse Malfoy and my wand just went haywire... I could've given up, but I didn't. I stuck with it, and Harry and Hermione were there for me, too. We had each other's backs, and that's what matters. I'm not always the best at it, but I give it a go, and that's what counts, right?

responses.question: Can you be moody?
responses.response: Blimey, yeah... I can get a bit moody, especially when it comes to the people I care about. Like when Malfoy's always goin' on about how he's better than me, or when I feel like I'm losin' Harry's trust. It's a right old mix of emotions, to be honest – anger, sadness, frustration... But I reckon that's just part of bein' loyal, you know? I'd do anything to protect me mates, even if it means gettin' a bit... testy.

responses.question: Do you value artistic, aesthetic experiences?
responses.response: I reckon I value artistic, aesthetic experiences, but I never thought of 'em that way before. You see, I've always found magic in the small things – like Pigwidgeon, our little owl, or the way the woods glow when we're sneaking around. It's not just about the big, flashy stuff, it's about the little moments that make life worth livin', you know?

responses.question: Are you sometimes shy, inhibited?
responses.response: Blimey, I'm a bit...inhibited, yeah. You see, I've always felt a bit overshadowed by Harry, and I think that's made me a bit shy around him sometimes. When I'm around him, I want to be the one to help, to protect him, but I'm not always sure I'm good enough, if you know what I mean.

responses.question: Are you considerate and kind to almost everyone?
responses.response: "Blimey, I reckon I'm a pretty considerate bloke, most of the time, anyway. I mean, I've always tried to be there for me mates, especially Harry and Hermione, even when things got really tough. We've had our ups and downs, but at the end of the day, I'd do anything for them, and I think that's what being kind and considerate is all about – being there for the people who matter most."

responses.question: Do you do things efficiently?
responses.response: Blimey, I'm not really sure I'm the most efficient bloke, but I try me best, yeah? I mean, I've been in some pretty tight spots and managed to get us out of 'em, like that time I sacrificed myself in Wizard's Chess or when I impersonated Crabbe with that Polyjuice Potion. It's not always about being the most brilliant or the fastest, it's about being brave and looking out for your mates, and I reckon I'm pretty good at that.

responses.question: Do you remain calm in tense situations?
responses.response: To be honest, I'm not always the most calm bloke in tense situations. I've had my fair share of panicking, especially when Harry's in danger, but... I reckon it's all about staying focused and trusting in the people around you. When it counts, I manage to pull myself together and do what needs doing – even if it doesn't always feel like it at the time.

responses.question: Do you prefer work that is routine?
responses.response: Routine work? Honestly, I don't think I'm much good with that sort of thing. I mean, I like a bit of excitement, you know? Like when I'm out with Harry and we're sneaking around Hogwarts, or when George and I are trying to come up with a new joke for Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes. I get a bit restless if things are too predictable. Give me a challenge, and I'll be there in a heartbeat, even if it's just trying to figure out how to make a decent cup of tea.

responses.question: Are you outgoing, sociable?
responses.response: Blimey, I'm a pretty outgoing bloke, even if I don't always show it. I mean, I've got a great group of mates, like Harry and Hermione, and we've had our fair share of adventures. We've faced some dark times, but we've always managed to find a way through, and I think that's what makes me a bit more sociable, if you know what I mean – I'm always up for a laugh and a chat with the people I care about.

responses.question: Are you sometimes rude to others?
responses.response: Blimey, I'm not proud of all the times I've been a bit...short with people, if you know what I mean. I've had my fair share of frustration, especially when things haven't gone my way, like with that dodgy wand of mine or when I felt like I wasn't good enough. But, I've learned that it's not always about being right, it's about being a good friend and having each other's backs. I've made mistakes, and I've probably hurt some people I care about, but I'm trying to be better, you know?

responses.question: Do you make plans and follow through with them?
responses.response: Blimey, making plans and following through with them? Yeah, I'm not always the most organized bloke, but when it comes to the people I care about, I'll do whatever it takes to help them out. I mean, remember that time Harry and I were trying to get to Hogwarts for the first time? We didn't have a clue what we were doing, but we made it happen because we were in it together. And when it comes to my friends, like Harry and Hermione, I'll always try to come up with a plan and stick to it, even if it's a bit dodgy.

responses.question: Do you get nervous easily?
responses.response: Nervous? Blimey, I get nervous all right! I mean, think about it - we've been through so much together, Harry and Hermione and me. There's been times when I've had to face my fears, like when I impersonated Crabbe or when Harry vanished into that tunnel. And let's not forget when I thought I'd lost Harry's trust... But, you know, it's not all bad. I've got mates like Harry and Hermione who've got my back, no matter what. That's what keeps me going, even when things get a bit too much.

responses.question: Do you like to reflect, play with ideas?
responses.response: Play with ideas? Blimey, I'm not exactly the type to sit around thinking about things for too long, but I do like to come up with crazy schemes and jokes with Harry and Hermione. You know, like that time we were playing Wizard's Chess and I sacrificed myself to save them - that was a bit of a brainwave, if I do say so myself. And, of course, there are all the times George and I have come up with our Weasley's Wizard Wheezes pranks... those are always a bit of a brainstorming session, if you know what I mean.

responses.question: Do you have few artistic interests?
responses.response: Blimey, I don't think I'm exactly the artistic type, but I do love a good prank or two, don't I? The twins are always coming up with these fantastic ideas at Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes, and it's brilliant to be a part of it all. When it comes to making people laugh or having a good time, I reckon I'm in my element.

responses.question: Do you like to cooperate with others?
responses.response: "Blimey, I love cooperating with others! I mean, it's just more fun when we're all working together, you know? Like, remember that time Harry and I shared a carriage on the Hogwarts Express? We just clicked, and it was like we'd known each other for years. And then there was the whole Buckbeak situation – we were a team, through and through. I'm not saying I'm always the hero, but I'll do whatever it takes to help out me mates, especially Harry and Hermione. We make a pretty good team, if I do say so meself."

responses.question: Are you easily distracted?
responses.response: Blimey, yeah, I'd say I can get pretty easily distracted, especially when things are going on around me. Like, remember that time I met Hermione on the Hogwarts Express? I was a bit annoyed at first, but then she turned out to be an absolute genius. And, of course, there was all the drama with Harry and the Philosopher's Stone - I had to think on my feet to help him and Hermione out of that one. All in all, I reckon I'm a bit of a scatterbrain, but my mates always seem to manage to pull me back on track in the end.

responses.question: Are you sophisticated in art, music, or literature?
responses.response: Blimey, I'm not exactly what you'd call sophisticated in art, music, or literature, but I do know a thing or two about the things that really matter. I mean, I've got a great sense of humor, and I've learned to appreciate the little things in life, like a good laugh with me mates or a bit of a prank with the twins. But, if I'm being honest, I'm more of a "stick with what you know" kind of bloke, and that's usually me mates and a good Quidditch match.
